Spotify will now transfer your music data. This may take several minutes depending on the size of your library. Spotify will then automatically restart, which may take a little longer than usual.\n\nYou can continue listening while we transfer your data.
There might be something wrong with your SD card. Check permissions and try again.
Spotify will automatically restart when this process is complete.
Choose where to store your music data.

Leave Car Mode? Tapping the floating button on home will get you back in.

On the road? Use your voice.

Turn on Bluetooth on both devices.
Set the playing device to pairing mode. Tip: Most wireless speakers and headphones have a Bluetooth button to press.
Allow a few seconds for your phone to detect your second device. Once it appears, select it to pair. When pairing is complete, you’ll see or hear a message such as “Paired” or “Connected”.
Open Spotify and play! The sound now comes from your chosen device.
Make sure your Chromecast is connected to the same Wi-Fi as your phone.
On your phone, play a song and select == Devices Available.
Choose your Chromecast device from the list, and use your phone as a remote control.
Open Spotify on your computer. Make sure you\'re logged in to the same Spotify account.
On your phone, play a song and select == Devices Available.
Select your computer from the list, and use your phone as a remote control.
Use your phone to control what\'s playing on your game console. First, make sure your phone and game console are connected to the same Wi-Fi network.
On your PlayStation® console,go to the PlayStation™ music app.
Download Spotify from the Microsoft Store on your Xbox One.
Connect the speaker to the same Wi-Fi as your phone.
On your phone, play a song and select == Devices Available.
Choose your speaker from the list, and use your phone as a remote control.
Download and open the Spotify app on your Smart TV, video game console or set top box. Make sure your phone is on the same Wi-Fi.
On your phone, play a song and select == Devices Available.
Choose your device from the list, and use your phone as a remote control.
To connect to Google Cast devices, update Google Play Services.

Your phone connects to the car stereo to play through the speakers. How do you usually connect to the car stereo?

Connect your phone to Wi-Fi to start downloading the latest update.\n\nIn the meantime leave Car Thing in your car, powered up.

Turning this on will help you save data by showing fewer images and reducing music quality.
Sets your music quality to low (equivalent to 24 kbit/s) and disables artist canvases.

We have detected that you are running out of storage space. To work correctly, Spotify needs free space to store files. You can fix this by deselecting playlists for download or choosing to clear all your Spotify data from the settings menu.
You won\'t be able to play this offline.
This episode is in your %s playlists - if you remove it, those playlists won\'t be available offline.

To download this episode, go to Settings and allow Download using cellular.
The update was successfully downloaded to this phone.\n\nHead back to your car to reconnect to Car Thing and continue setup.
